description: The law applies to all specific situations
title: The law protects me in all situations!
content:
All children have the right to embrace or choose their culture, language and religion, even if this places them in a minority in the state or locality where they live.

Every child who is differently-abled has the right to special care and protection. He or she must be helped to develop as effectively as possible, in ways equal to those provided to all children.  The parents of a differently-abled child should receive assistance if necessary to ensure that child's appropriate growth and healthy development.

Children who have been subjected to violence, mistreatment or negligence should receive special protection and care in order to allow them to return to as normal a life as possible.
